answers.answer: Hi.  I'm not a medical professional, just the parent of a kid with diabetes.  Honeytheone's question is appropriate.  If your child is diabetic, the answer could likely be very different than if not.

Hi,My suggestion would be that she might be experiencing high blood pressure, as headaches are sometimes associated with this. Yes it is exteme but if she has diabetes this might be the case. Or it might be that she needs to correct eye sight problems with glasses. Just speaking from personal experience. Ultimately, you should carry her to a professional doctor and have it checked out.

question: Hi,My 15 year old daughter gets migraines everyday around the same time, 2pm and taking aspirin or any other pain reliever does not seem to help, today she vomitted and has the migraine, I am unsure at this point what to do as she says the pain is at the top of her head, please advise
title: Migraines that my juvenile child has
